intro: Isolepis poiretii, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a flowering plant native to wetland and marshy environments in southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant has slender, grass-like stems that often form dense clumps, and its inflorescence consists of a spike of small, three-ranked flowers. Its leaves are narrow and strap-shaped, typically growing from the base of the plant. Isolepis poiretii plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
